ygData.subject: -=- Autobots -=- Arrival -=-
ygData.msgSnippet: OOC: Jordan gave me permission to control JetV for a little bit in this post. ... The Autobot ship careens downward  at a 43 degrees angle, then pulls up a bit

Subject: -=- Autobots -=- Arrival -=-
Message-ID: <3B4478E9.21095.45B0C5@localhost>
Priority: normal
X-mailer: Pegasus Mail for Win32 (v3.12c)
From: "rAuq" <rauq@...>

OOC: Jordan gave me permission to control JetV for a little bit in 
this post.

--- Pacifix / Hidden One ---

The Autobot ship careens downward  at a 43 degrees angle, then 
pulls up a bit due to JetV's skillful piloting. It become painfully 
obvious that they are going to crash but the ship should stay 
intact. Pacifix sends a commlink to the crew and passengers:

"This is Commander Pacifix. Autobots, a crash is immenent, brace 
for impact, this could be rough. ETA of crash is approximately 23 
seconds and counting."

Pacifix cuts of fhis comm and takes a seat beside JetV, in his 
commander chair. He straps himself in, noting that all other 
Autobots had done the same. (I'm saying that because I'm not 
waiting for people with Autobots to respond to this email.) Pacifix 
remains calm and mostly impassive, and axious look catches him 
for a second, but he shrugs it off, and waits for impact.

He closes his eyes as his console beeps, and spouts current ETA 
to crash, '12 seconds to impact.' Without opening his eyes, he 
grabs his support handles, and braces himself. JetV doing likewise.

JetV guides the Hidden One down towards the largish island in 
central Indonesia. The ship smashes into the the start of a small 
valley, just to the left of some massive mountains. The loud 
screeching sounds scare much of the surrounding Wildlife from 
whatever they were doing, and forces them into hiding. Birds can 
be seen flocking away from the crash site. The ship slides along 
the valley, turning sideways somewhat, and starts to catch dirt. 
Soon the ship has slowed down drasticly, having picked up several 
tons of dirt, trees, rocks, and various other objects onto the top and 
around it.

After coming to a complete stop, the ship now appears to be a 
large hill consisting of dirt, trees and rocks (obviously =P). Pacifix 
runs a system diagnostic on the ship. He discovers that the major 
thrusters have been disabled, and are now covered with debri from 
the crash. The computers chipset and motherboard are intact, and 
functioning perfectly. The ship's medium armour is damaged 
moderately, but that can be repaired. The landers have been 
destroyed, but Pacifix finds that understandable. He stops 
checking the systems, guessing with fair accuracy the rest of what 
the computer would have said. Pacifix stops when he feels a slight 
tug at his Autobot sensor. It seems to have picked up another 
Autobot signa-- no wait, there were two, no three signals... Pacifix 
frowns, dismissing it as a Decepticon trick for the time being, but 
the though rests at the back of his mind to be accessed at a later 
date.

JetV gets out of his chair, just before Pacifix detatches himself, 
and stands. Pacifix heads for the exit of the control room, JetV 
following. "That was a weird occurance. I hope we don't have go 
through that again." Pacifix keeps walking, nodding for JetV to 
follow, "Now the hard part begins..." He heads down the hall 
towards the storage bay. He opens a commlink to all Autobots, 
"Autobots, there is a meeting in the storage bay to start soon, get 
there ASAP. Pacifix out."

Pacifix and JetV enter the storage bay. JetV heads over and sits 
down on a crate. Pacifix sets up a small box for him to talk on so 
that all will be able to hear him, and he waits...

ooc: Thanks Jordan. =)
